name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sleeps, ishuta, mikeronomicon, Thorfinn, NotGodot, GeyserShitdick, lamelliform, atticusonline, Jesus, chatterjee, littlefatdog, pogo, Pigs)

name: chaesar
text: Maybe he doesn't think he can put out more than 240 pages of crap.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sleeps, mikeronomicon, Thorfinn, Lacrimus, GeyserShitdick, atticusonline, chatterjee, littlefatdog, pogo, Pigs)

name: greenkoolayd
text: A comment left by greenkoolayd was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by scottawesome, katsura, Zeno)

name: delzhand
text: I think it's a case of self loathing.  Look how angrily he types!

name: epicurus
text: I think the idea is that he picked the one with the lowest number of pages, that being the sole criteria.

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by glorify, pitseleh, atticusonline, Creepwood, Darthemed)

name: featurelessvoid
text: The cheapest gig means the fewest pages, and thus the least time spent writing it, and thus the smallest amount of dying inside as he types each wretched word.

name: connellingus
text: Also, 240 pages in six days is a lot easier than 320 pages in three days.

name: deancain29
text: I got schooled

name: puguglypress
text: (Movie announcer's voice) This summer. You Got Served... goes to school.

name: soticoto
text: You got taken to school in Trent Reznor's Volvo of Despair.

name: shoveland
text: Didn't the girl used to be from soma place in Iowa? Strange that I would remember such a thing...maybe...or am I just imagining?

name: greenkoolayd
text: women do that from time to time.....

name: tpederson
text: I love how they expect three books in (from the strip date) 8 days.  Now, that's quailty litrature!

name: tekende
text: They expect one book. The letter tells him to choose.

name: varnish
text: My mother once picked up a crate of Harlequin Romance books at a garage sale for about a buck. The back cover of every single one read exactly like these. There must be a lot of desperate writers out there.

name: arbys
text:
Writing is not exactly a high-paying profession. The handful of rich writers there are almost all either purveyors of the lowest common denominator, or else lucked out on a movie deal.

In most cases, both.

That said, I would assume even harlequin romance writers get a royalty percentage.

name: presterjohn
text: I would assume the royalty payout on Harlequin Midlist Novel #343 is less than staggering. Connie'll have to write a whole bunch of them.

name: professoryes
text: Russian sojourns always get me in the mood to write trite romance novels.

name: johnfen
text: I love that its Kristi with an i.

name: philophobe
text:
The most spot-on detail is that Kristi-with-an-'i'-in-Series-Development's signature is a hastily-done lowercase cursive 'k'.

Apologies for the glut of hyphens in my re-ply.

name: soticoto
text: Forcing Cornelius to write about bridging the class divide? How barbaric!

name: dusty
text: Really it's not as romantic as people think, people of lower class are not as classy.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Wednesday Blogs

Molly: There's nothing sadder than a business card.
Onstad: It is interesting to be twenty years apart from the last experience.
Little Nephew: I dig on me gewordstra minner.

name: mattylite
text: LN's blog today is a triumph.  Read it.

name: irondave
text: Truer words were never spoken.

name: tekende
text: I can't read LN's crap.

name: invidious
text: Normally I can't either, but his attempt to describe the wine is comedy gold.

name: rowboat
text: I used to feel that way, too, but if you put a little effort into it it gets easier and is very much worth it in the end. Basically the same skill it takes to be able to read gladi posts, except the LN blogs are almost always mind-blowing as opposed to just occasionally.

name: saulbellow
text: How did someone from Ebbs, Texas end up with the name Beneline Aulogois? You are typing too fast, Cornelius. Too fast .

name: i_love_kate
text: If he goes below three words per second, the bomb goes off.

name: saulbellow
text: A comment left by saulbellow was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by whoper, atticusonline, Art-Vader)

name: rykan
text: Am I the only one who would actually buy a Harlequin romance novel written by Onstad? (It would be the ONLY time I bought a romance novel, mind).

name: bassguitarbill
text: What exactly is a "cheese-boy"?

name: paperboy_2000
text: Fondue Man's teenage sidekick.

name: whoper
text: A dangling modifier?  That's rather unlike Connie.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
One day in a cold Russian October class disparities fueled a mighty, if misguided, revolution.

Now it moves girl-porn.

It's not easy being a socialist.

name: puguglypress
text: Oh man, great comment.

name: hannibalv
text: My favorite bit about this strip is that a different word starting with "D" is used to describe the class issues in each scenario:  "class disparities", "class differences", and "class distinctions".

name: samspud
text: The romance novel industry uses a lot of synonyms.
